Value:
No Man's Sky Frontiers brings a vast array of new features. For full details please see www.nomanssky.com.

* Alien settlements can now be encountered on all inhabited planets.
* Become overseer of a settlement to grow it from a tiny village into a flourishing town.
* Make important decisions about settlement legislation to keep populations happy, productive and thriving.
* Construct more elaborate bases than ever with hundreds of new base parts and advanced building controls.
* Save slots have increased from 5 to 15, and Quicksilver purchases are now accessible from any save slot.

Hello Games has been hard at work to improve and expand No Man's Sky. We hope you enjoy. :)

Thank you so much,
Hello Games
No Man's Sky has detected that the save files in <TECHNOLOGY>%DIRECTORY%<> are read-only, and cannot be written to.

This will prevent your game from saving. Please check the <STELLAR>file properties<> of your save files in Windows and ensure they do not have the <STELLAR>Read-only<> or <STELLAR>Hidden<> properties checked.
Edit Mode Enabled SLASH<> Change Existing Parts
Contruction Mode Enabled SLASH<> Place New Parts
Placement unavailable SLASH<> Select parts from the grid (FE_BACK<>)

This clear glass aqueduct encloses a perpetually churning supply of 'liquid'.

Weld into different shapes to create mesmerizing displays in your base.

This clear glass aqueduct encloses a perpetually churning supply of 'liquid'.

Weld together with different duct shapes to create mesmerizing displays in your base.

This clear glass aqueduct encloses a perpetually churning supply of 'liquid'. This X-shaped configuration allows for connecting four ducts in a cruciform arrangement.

Weld together with different duct shapes to create mesmerizing displays in your base.

This clear glass aqueduct encloses a perpetually churning supply of 'liquid'. This L-shaped configuration allows for curves in duct connections.

Weld together with different duct shapes to create mesmerizing displays in your base.

This clear glass aqueduct encloses a perpetually churning supply of 'liquid'. This T-shaped configuration allows for creating branches in duct connections.

Weld together with different duct shapes to create mesmerizing displays in your base.

An exclusive buildable base ornament, cast in glass.
This astronaut statue is a tribute to all galactic explorers.

An exclusive buildable base ornament, cast in glass.
This statue is a decorative replica of an Atlas Interface. Its core rotates, powered by an unknown force...

An exclusive buildable base ornament, cast in glass.
This statue depicts a primitive ancient creature, sought after by many early explorers.

An exclusive buildable base ornament, cast in glass.
This statue depicts a long-necked quadrupedal species.

An exclusive buildable base ornament, cast in glass.
This statue depicts a Gek gesturing towards the sky.

An exclusive buildable base ornament, cast in glass.
This statue depicts the iconic starship Alpha Vector.

An exclusive buildable base ornament, cast in glass.
This statue depicts the Sentinel Walker, an advanced combat unit.

An exclusive placeable decal, to add flair and decoration to bases.
This decal depicts an explorer gazing toward the stars in a soft blue sky.

An exclusive placeable decal, to add flair and decoration to bases.
This decal depicts a colossal alien beast striding across a rust-colored landscape.

An exclusive placeable decal, to add flair and decoration to bases.
This decal depicts a landed starship, awaiting the return of its pilot.

An exclusive placeable decal, to add flair and decoration to bases.
This decal depicts a pair of starships journeying towards a galactic core.

An exclusive placeable decal, to add flair and decoration to bases.
This decal depicts a legendary haunted diving mask.

An exclusive placeable decal, to add flair and decoration to bases.
This decal depicts a starship pulsing past Nada and Polo's anomalous home.

Reinforced <TECHNOLOGY>Timber<> building module, widespread in basic structures across the galaxy.

Conforms to Universal Building Standards 2.3b, ensuring maximum compatibility with other prefab structures. Rapid grid snapping allows for quick assembly of custom shelter layouts.

Reinforced <TECHNOLOGY>Stone<> building module, widespread in basic structures across the galaxy.

Conforms to Universal Building Standards 2.3b, ensuring maximum compatibility with other prefab structures. Rapid grid snapping allows for quick assembly of custom shelter layouts.

Reinforced <TECHNOLOGY>Alloy<> building module, widespread in basic structures across the galaxy.

Conforms to Universal Building Standards 2.3b, ensuring maximum compatibility with other prefab structures. Rapid grid snapping allows for quick assembly of custom shelter layouts.
An opulent floor covering with a diamond pattern. Woven from a blend of iridescent sandworm silk and dirt-wicking nano-fibres, this ornate rug is both beautiful and durable.
A gold-rimmed pot for storing anything from potpourri to GekNip to proto-sausage pie. A ceramic blend of ferrite and clay, this ornament lends a rustic touch to base decor.
This elegant hexagonal table features an inbuilt thermal grille, for maintaining the temperature of cooked products, or for warming or cooling aching fingers.

This beautiful golden half counter is coated in a thin layer of living glass, ensuring thermal stability and a scratch-free finish. An illuminated base assists visibility in all lighting conditions.

Place alongside <TECHNOLOGY>Golden Counter<> and <TECHNOLOGY>Golden Counter Corner<> modules to create bespoke counter layouts.

This beautiful golden counter is coated in a thin layer of living glass, ensuring thermal stability and a scratch-free finish. An illuminated base assists visibility in all lighting conditions.

Place alongside <TECHNOLOGY>Golden Counter Corner<> and <TECHNOLOGY>Golden Half Counter<> modules to create bespoke counter layouts.

This beautiful golden counter corner is coated in a thin layer of living glass, ensuring thermal stability and a scratch-free finish. An illuminated base assists visibility in all lighting conditions.

Place alongside <TECHNOLOGY>Golden Counter<> and <TECHNOLOGY>Golden Half Counter<> modules to create bespoke counter layouts.

A rustic-styled vessel for brewing and serving hot beverages, crafted in the traditional style of the Gek First Spawn.
This decorative tableware lends a touch of comfort and style to bases.
A softly-glowing table lamp with a self-sustaining thermonuclear core. Adjustable for focused nighttime reading or ambient lighting.

A rustic-styled drinking vessel: forged from a tough copper alloy, blackened with regis grease and laser-sealed.
This decorative tableware lends a touch of comfort and style to bases.

A rustic-styled eating vessel: forged from a tough copper alloy, blackened with regis grease and laser-sealed.
This decorative tableware lends a touch of comfort and style to bases.

A shallow, double-handled pan for preparing food. Advanced fluoropolymer technology creates a non-stick, self-cleaning surface.
This decorative cookware lends a touch of comfort and style to bases.

A stylish three-legged stool, reinforced to support ten times the weight of an average adult Vy'keen. The polyurethane-nanite seat morphs to accommodate any body shape, providing maximum bespoke comfort to the occupant.

A vintage-styled tap, fitted with laser-enhanced filtration technology. Suitable for dispensing all varieties of liquid, from potable beverages to corrosive acids. Not recommended for use with living slime.
A heavyweight canvas wall decoration. Suspended from Vy'keen Artillery-grade rope, this base adornment is engineered to endure all weather conditions.
A set of four mini canvas wall decorations. Suspended from Vy'keen Artillery-grade rope, this base adornment is engineered to endure all weather conditions.
A set of three mini canvas wall decorations. Suspended from Vy'keen Artillery-grade rope, this base adornment is engineered to endure all weather conditions.
An attention-grabbing welcome sign, illuminated by an array of gas-discharge tubes. Suitable for hanging in commercial premises, or in bases as an eccentric home decoration.
This full sail replicates the design of the ancient maritime trade vessels of the Gek, and makes for a striking nautical-themed home decoration.
These offset sails replicate the design of the ancient maritime trade vessels of the Gek, and make for a striking nautical-themed home decoration.
These asymmetrical sails replicate the design of the ancient maritime trade vessels of the Gek, and make for a striking nautical-themed home decoration.
This draped canvas half-sail replicates the design of the ancient maritime trade vessels of the Gek, and makes for a striking nautical-themed home decoration.

A holographic representation of a world, mappable to any known galactic coordinates to simulate local planetary data. Generates an impression of scholarly intelligence when furnishing office environments.
An attractive silk wall hanging, richly dyed and adorned with web-thin strands of gold and cadmium. Lends the impression of opulence to any room.
An opulent floor covering with a circular pattern. Woven from a blend of iridescent sandworm silk and dirt-wicking nano-fibres, this ornate rug is both beautiful and durable.
A map showing the location of a nearby planetary settlement, acquired from the Space Station Cartographer<>. Select the map and use Plot Route (FE_ALT1<>) to pin the location in your Exosuit display.
Hello! Visitor smells strange. Here to spend units?
Visitor is friend of settlement? Bring units?
Welcome, new friend! Bring wealth to settlement?
Welcome! All friends here in settlement!
Sorry friend, cannot visit home today! No time to clean!
Settlement impress friend? Manufacture very best goods here.
Friend wish to join settlement? Life is good here.
Best employment opportunities in settlement! Gek become rich quick!
Friend bring units to spend in settlement?
Strength is required for settlement life, interloper. How strong are you?
Grah! You may visit, interloper, but do not trespass.
This is our settlement, interloper. Show respect as you visit.
Grah! Only strongest can join settlement!
Prove your worth, interloper! Settlement life will destroy the weak!
We are very proud of this settlement! Bountiful resources, honourable members!
The sentinels destroyed our great city, but they will not destroy this settlement!
Glorious freedom in settlement life. Vy'keen ancestors would be proud!
No time to talk, interloper. Work to be done!
What brings you to our settlement, traveller-entity?
Traveller-entity wishes to be a member of this settlement?
Ah. Convergence expected traveller-entity would visit this settlement.
Welcome to our tiny convergence, organic entity.
You are most welcome in our settlement, traveller-entity.
A visitor to our settlement? How fascinating. Welcome.
What do you think of our settlement experiment, traveller-entity?
Greetings, unknown entity. Welcome to this settlement.
Welcome, strange entity. May you learn much from our settlement.
Clever overseer! Rival settler is workshy, does not tell truth! Friend will make good decision, yes?
Happy to see overseer friend! Settlement life is good.
Settlement production meet overseer approval? Settler friends work hard!
Visit for settlement decision, overseer? I am best worker here!
Friend is best supervisor! Overseer before you was idiot!
Overseer friend, hello! Business is good in settlement.
Settlement much more peaceful since friend arrive.
Greetings, overseer. Settlement create much profit!
Glad to have traveller-friend for overseer. Settlement feels like home now.
Believe overseer will make honourable decision for settlement! Show no mercy!
Nothing to report, overseer. All is well.
Overseer integrity is strong. Vy'keen settlers respect.
Impressed by interloper's performance as overseer.
Overseer demonstrates wisdom in settlement decision duties. Vy'keen respect!
Settlement performance is strong. Overseer rank is well-earned! Grah!
Settlement welcomes our overseer. Tribute available at terminal.
Too many sentinels visit settlement! Demand freedom to kill! Death! Death! Death!
Traveller-entity has improved production by unexpected percent. Convergence is watching.
Our settlement has waited for one such as you, overseer.
Settlement is performing well. Settlers are pleased. Convergence is pleased.
Settlers are joyful, overseer. Production is in excess of projection.
Hello, overseer. Korvax is performing research into future settlement facility.
Korvax awaits next settlement decision, overseer. Expecting intelligent procedure.

Assist the local population in the construction of a <STELLAR>planetary settlement<>. Perform key actions at the <STELLAR>Settlement Interface<> or in the <STELLAR>Overseer's Office<>.

As overseer of a settlement, you will make key decision, direct the <TRADEABLE>construction of buildings<>, and resolve <SPECIAL>disputes<> between citizens.

A well-managed settlement will produce plenty of materials - enough that a successful overseer may claim <STELLAR>surplus resources<> each day. However, unproductive settlements may go into <FUEL>debt<>. Construct new buildings and set new policies from the Overseer's office to turn the settlement around, reduce its debts and improve the lives of its citizens.

Warning: settlements will periodically attract the attention of Sentinel forces. Check the current Sentinel alert level from the settlement management interface. The Overseer may have to defend the settlement against Sentinel attacks.

ACCESSING PLANETARY SETTLEMENT INTERFACE...<AUDIO>UI_Destination_Reached<> ACCESS GRANTED... 
Current Overseer status: [ <SPECIAL>MISSING?<> / <FUEL>DECEASED?<> ] ... Overseer position presumed vacant. Apply for settlement management?

I detected an emergency broadcast over my starship's long-range communicator.
The hologram was pre-recorded, appearing to show a lifeform in some distress. They urge any nearby ships to assist them against a Sentinel incursion.
Save the settlement from the Sentinels

Distress signal coordinates have been entered into the starship's navigation systems. Signal appears to be planetside.
Reach the coordinates and investigate the signal source.
Emergency Broadcast<> detected Answer the Communicator by pressing QUICK_MENU<>

Reach the source of the emergency broadcast
Signal source appears to be <STELLAR>planetside<>
Though the transmission is infused with static and its alien speech garbled, one thing is unmistakable. This lifeform is in great distress. Their broadcast contains a set of coordinates...

Aiee! Sentinel forces approach our new settlement Convergence! Planetary mind cannot survive such attack! No peace is possible on this world!
The overseer has  <AUDIO>TXT_RadioNoise<><STELLAR>kzkzzt<>

Assistance, all friends! Settlement promising for trade success, but Sentinels dangerous! Help! Offer excellent rewards!
The overseer has  <AUDIO>TXT_RadioNoise<><STELLAR>kzkzzt<>

Grah! Pathetic Sentinels challenge Vy'keen freedom! Settlement progress will not be halted! Take arms all warriors! To us! Grah!
The overseer has  <AUDIO>TXT_RadioNoise<><STELLAR>kzkzzt<>
The transmission's pre-recorded hologram fades as I shut down my starship communicator. Their coordinates point to a nearby planet...

Assist the local population in the construction of a <STELLAR>planetary settlement<>. Perform key actions at the <STELLAR>Settlement Interface<> or in the <STELLAR>Overseer's Office<>.

As overseer of a settlement, you will make key decisions, direct the <TRADEABLE>construction of buildings<>, and resolve <SPECIAL>disputes<> between citizens.

A well-managed settlement will produce plenty of materials - enough that a successful overseer may claim <STELLAR>surplus resources<> each day.
Investigate the distress signal at the planetary settlement. Assist the settlers with their problems and they may allow you to join their settlement.

The Overseer's Office is the heart of the settlement. The settlement status can be viewed at any time from the office's <STELLAR>Administration Terminal<>. Improve the settlement to <TRADEABLE>generate resources<>, which can be collected daily from the Administration Terminal.

Locate the <STELLAR>construction site<> to continue building assembly. Building is done in several stages. Each stage requires both <COMMODITY>materials<> and <SPECIAL>time<>.

Assemble materials for the <TECHNOLOGY>%BUILDING%<>
Collect %ITEM% for the <TECHNOLOGY>%STAGE%<>: %CURRENT%/%AMOUNT%

%ITEM_TIP%

The <STELLAR>Administration Terminal<> in the Overseer's Office allows you to direct construction of additional buildings. Proceed to the office and make a decision about which buildings to construct. When necessary, other key decisions will be presented via this terminal.

Once placed, locate the <STELLAR>construction site<> to proceed to building assembly. Construction is done in several stages. Each stage requires both <COMMODITY>materials<> and <SPECIAL>time<>.

The <STELLAR>Administration Terminal<> in the Overseer's Office allows you to direct your settlement. Return regularly to direct construction, set key policies, or resolve disputes between the citizens.

Settlement status can be seen from its central interface, or from the Administration Terminal. The status interface allows the <STELLAR>daily collection of surplus resources<>. Resource quality and amount varies with the settlement. Well-managed settlements will produce <COMMODITY>additional goods<>.

SENTINEL FORCES ELIMINATED SLASH<> SUPPRESSION FORCES RETREATING
The Korvax buzzes, grateful for the assistance. But it is clear they are tired, worn down from the fight. If no-one helps them, I fear their settlement will not last much longer.

The little alien hops around, grateful for my assistance in fighting the Sentinels. But it is clear they are tired, worn down from the fight. If no-one helps them, I fear their settlement will not last much longer.

The Vy'keen salutes, pleased to see another join their fight against the Sentinels. But it is clear they are tired, worn down from the fight. If no-one helps them, I fear their settlement will not last much longer.
Traveller-Entity is most effective at Sentinel intervention. A useful skill. Worlds are hostile to life. Perhaps Traveller-Entity will become Settler-Entity and assist our small Convergence?
Gratitude, friend! Life here is hard, yes? Hard but profitable! Much opportunity here! We will do business together, yes? Friend will be new settlement overseer?
Grah! Interloper fights well! Existing commander is disgraced by their failure! Interloper must replace them! Strong command required!
Perhaps I could assist these settlers? The Overseer position appears to be newly vacant...
This settlement must be the source of the distress signal. What are they doing here, building a life exposed to the harsh planetary existence, battered by the elements?
Traveller-Entity! You are just in time! Our small Convergence is under attack!
Friend! You receive our signal, yes? Here to help, yes? Brought weapon, yes?
Grah! To arms, interloper! It is good you are here to fight with us! To the death!

Before I can speak, I hear the wail of a siren. A hostile buzz descends upon the town.
The Sentinels have arrived...

You have located a struggling <STELLAR>planetary settlement<>, fighting against harsh conditions and constant Sentinel harassment.

Speak with the citizens to learn more, and to assist them in their efforts to build the town.

A visitor, %NAME1%, has demand audience with the Overseer
A stranger named %NAME1% has requested an audience
A stranger named %NAME1% has reported to the Overseer's office
%NAME1% is a stranger to this settlement. They wish to speak with the Overseer
%NAME1% recently arrived at the settlement, and has requested the attention of the Overseer
<VAL_ON>Resolution required:<> Allow %NAME1% to join the settlement?
A visitor, %NAME1%, has called on us to provide refuge
A visitor, %NAME1%, has begged for a place to stay
A tired and weary explorer, %NAME1%, has asked to join the settlement
A visitor, %NAME1%, has arrived. They are on edge, and have asked for shelter
A weary-looking visitor, %NAME1%, has arrived. They have asked to join the settlement
A visitor, %NAME1%, has blockaded themselves in the Overseer's office. They will not leave until they are allowed to stay
%NAME1% has fled another settlement, citing the tyranny of its Overseer
%NAME1% has fled another settlement, after its destruction by the Sentinels
%NAME1% has fled another settlement after a violent quarrel
%NAME1% has arrived here from another settlement. They wish to defect
They claim to be %JOB%, though they announce this with some nervousness
They offer their services as %JOB%, though system records show no trace of their prior existence
They claim a great deal of experience as %JOB%, though there is a curious look upon their face
They claim to be %JOB%. The security drones have verified their story
They offer their services as %JOB%, a look of hope in their eyes
They offer their experience as %JOB%, and present their qualifications
They claim to be highly skilled as %JOB%. They stare, expecting their boast to speak for itself
They promise they have much to offer the settlement, including their skills as %JOB%
They present their qualifications as %JOB%, shifting their weight slightly as they do so
They present themselves as %JOB% of some renown. They feel they have much to offer us
A visitor, %NAME1%, has called on us in a time of need
A visitor, %NAME1%, has come to us with a request for aid
A stranger named %NAME1% has comes to the settlement with a request
A visitor, %NAME1%, has come to us for help
A passing visitor, %NAME1%, has stumbled into the settlement. They require assistance
%NAME1% has arrived here from places unknown
%NAME1% was found lurking outside the settlement walls
%NAME1% was found unconscious by our scouts. Having been revived, they were escorted to the settlement
A passing stranger, %NAME1%, offers us thanks and praise for hearing their request.
They are in need of medical attention, with severe damage to their %ORGAN%
They ask for a place to hide. They do not elaborate on the circumstances, nor mention the length of time involved
They claim their hazard protection has failed, and they need time to shelter and make repairs
They are being pursued by the Sentinels, and hope to shelter within our walls
They say that their starship has failed, and they need tools and materials to make repairs
They say their communication systems have failed. They need to make a broadcast to call their home station
They have damaged their %ORGAN%, but they do not explain how. A puddle of liquid is accumulating at their feet
They claim to have been the victim of a pirate raid. They ask to borrow weapons so that they might seek their vengeance
They claim to be the sole survivor of a pirate attack that destroyed their freighter. They ask only for transportation back to the space station
They claim to have lost their memory and ask for help discovering their identity. Their only clue is a series of glyphs tattooed upon their hands..
They ask for temporary use of a settlement starship, but refuse to say why. They make elaborate promises to take good care of it
They apologise for the intrusion. All they need is a small 'loan'. They claim we will be handsomely rewarded
A stranger named %NAME1% has arrived with a retinue of followers
A stranger named %NAME1% has announced their grand arrival, and wishes to be conveyed to the Overseer
A stranger named %NAME1% asks to do business with the Overseer
%NAME1% requests to do business with the Overseer, and asks for respect as an equal
Unprompted, %NAME1% announces that they come in peace
They present a gift of <COMMODITY>%GIFT_ITEM%<>, with no strings attached
They offer tribute, presenting a gift of <COMMODITY>%GIFT_ITEM%<>. They smile
They are a visitor to this world, and bring <COMMODITY>%GIFT_ITEM%<> as a gesture of goodwill
They gesture elaborately, placing <COMMODITY>%GIFT_ITEM%<> upon the floor. It appears to be a gift of some sort
They have quarrelled with the system authorities, and offer us <COMMODITY>%GIFT_ITEM%<> to win our support
They wish to conduct some 'business' in this system, and offer us <COMMODITY>%GIFT_ITEM%<> in exchange for our discretion
They have heard of your administration, and wish to offer <COMMODITY>%GIFT_ITEM%<> as a token of goodwill
They claim to have benefited from a great surplus, and now share with local settlements as a way to share their good fortune. They present <COMMODITY>%GIFT_ITEM%<> and smile
They offer us a donation of <COMMODITY>%GIFT_ITEM%<>, as well as several thousand pages of complex documentation. Their aims are not clear
They seek converts to their philosophy, and offer <COMMODITY>%GIFT_ITEM%<> as an incentive
They claim to be a wanderer in the grand tradition of peaceful exploration, and offer <COMMODITY>%GIFT_ITEM%<> in recognition of our mutual interests
They say they are a philosopher, and wish to share their knowledge. The present the secret to <TECHNOLOGY>"%TECHGIFT%"<>
As an envoy from another settlement, they wish to share technology in a spirit of goodwill. They present the plans for <TECHNOLOGY>"%TECHGIFT%"<>
They have made a discovery, and wish to spread it far and wide. They present plans for <TECHNOLOGY>"%TECHGIFT%"<>
They offer plans for <TECHNOLOGY>"%TECHGIFT%"<>, free of charge. They ask only for proper credit as the inventor
With a smile, they offer plans for <TECHNOLOGY>"%TECHGIFT%"<>, no strings attached. They hope we find it satisfactory
They have been sent by system authorities to improve the lives of planetary settlers. They bring plans for <TECHNOLOGY>"%TECHGIFT%"<>
They believe that planetary settlers must look out for each other. They have brought plans for <TECHNOLOGY>"%TECHGIFT%"<>, free of charge
They claim to be working for an anonymous benefactor. They wish to help the settlement, and present the plans for <TECHNOLOGY>"%TECHGIFT%"<> as a gift
They are an envoy, though they will not reveal their patron. They present plans for <TECHNOLOGY>"%TECHGIFT%"<> as a gift to the settlement
They present their trade credentials, and offer to sell plans for <TECHNOLOGY>"%TECHGIFT%"<>
They present a whirl of holograms. They appear to be selling plans for <TECHNOLOGY>"%TECHGIFT%"<>
They make a series of remarkable claims about <TECHNOLOGY>"%TECHGIFT%"<>. They offer to sell the plans, for a reasonable fee..
They say how pleased they would be to see our settlement flourish. They ask if their <TECHNOLOGY>"%TECHGIFT%"<> would assist us, for a small fee..
They come to us in the spirit of free trade. They present the plans for <TECHNOLOGY>"%TECHGIFT%"<>, and name their price..
They present the plans for <TECHNOLOGY>"%TECHGIFT%"<>, in a spirit of cooperation. In return, all they ask is our mutual cooperation in making a donation..
A sales agent of some sort, they offer to sell the plans for <TECHNOLOGY>"%TECHGIFT%"<>
A travelling inventor, they offer to sell us plans for <TECHNOLOGY>"%TECHGIFT%"<>
A specialist engineer, they are seeking buyers for their latest invention, some sort of <TECHNOLOGY>"%TECHGIFT%"<>
a vial of dust from their homeworld
%NAME1% claims to have seen the settlement in a dream
%NAME1% claims to have been sent here by powerful (yet unidentified) forces
%NAME1% claims to have been led to us by a vision
%NAME1% says they have been following an echo. It has led them to us
%NAME1% asks if we hear the song that has led them here
%NAME1% claims to have followed a call from an automated distress signal
%NAME1% says they were brought to us by a whispering voice
%NAME1% has demanded an audience. Our medics indicate they are suffering a fever
They have inhaled the nanite foam, and share this warning: <FUEL>%UNTRANSLATED%<>
The wordstones have spoken to them, and they repeat their message: <FUEL>%UNTRANSLATED%<>
They bring the words of the monolith: <FUEL>%UNTRANSLATED%<>
They have travelled through a black hole, and now share the words they heard beyond the horizon:  <FUEL>%UNTRANSLATED%<>
They have seen the stars and the abyss, and now share the words of these extremes: <FUEL>%UNTRANSLATED%<>
They have faced the crimson that lurks beyond the stars, and share this warning: <FUEL>%UNTRANSLATED%<>
They fled the horrors of a derelict hulk to bring us this warning: <FUEL>%UNTRANSLATED%<>
They have consumed the whispering eggs, and now bring us this message: <FUEL>%UNTRANSLATED%<>
They have fought the whispering horrors to bring us this warning: <FUEL>%UNTRANSLATED%<>
They bring the words they wrested from the jaws of an abyssal horror: <FUEL>%UNTRANSLATED%<>
They are a prophet of the Atlas, and share this warning: <FUEL>%UNTRANSLATED%<>
First Spawn will rule again. Time is soon..
Do not drink the nanite syrup
A foul scent in the sky..
Murder is the nature of us all..
In synthetic sleep, I saw infinity end
The Atlas beckons. The Atlas demands
None of us should be here
In the water, there is only silence
The red accuser will consume you
Not one of you is worthy
For this service, they ask only for a small token, a mere trifle
They ask only for a bauble in return for their troubles
A scattering of coins is all they ask in return for their message
They ask if we might spare a trinket, in exchange for their message
For this sacrifice, they ask only for the smallest token

%NAME1% and %NAME2% claim ownership of the same %OWNITEM%

%NAME1% and %NAME2% both demand sole possession of the same %OWNITEM%
%NAME1% asserts %NAME2% has stolen their %OWNITEM%. %NAME2% insists it is theirs
%NAME1% has lost their %OWNITEM%. They insist %NAME2% is behind the loss, having recently acquired a similar item
On inspection, it shows signs of tampering, as if hacked at in a hurry
It is stained with some sort of bodily fluid. The stains appear recent
It is clearly very old, though there is little to suggest the true owner
The item itself is battered, and appears to have changed hands many times over the years
One side of the item is covered with a thin, greasy film. The other is clean, as if recently wiped
Testing has revealed no trace of %NAME2%'s DNA upon the item
Testing has revealed the stains upon the item match a personal 'signature' known to be associated with %NAME2%
%NAME2%'s name is scrawled upon the item, though the writing appears recent
%NAME2%'s name is scrawled upon the item. The writing is faded with age
Ultraviolet inspection reveals unusual biological stains. This material is at least a year old
Ultraviolet inspection reveals unusual biological stains. The material is fresh and reactive
Forensic analysis reveals microscopic scratches in its surface, as if someone had recently attempted to erase a marking
Forensic analysis reveals microscopic scratches in its surface. The etches are faded, consistent with a pattern of long use
Microbial testing reveals an algae micro-colony growing steadily on its surface. The colony is well-established
Microbial testing reveals significant biological action upon its surface, the mixing of two previously separate bacterial strains
Scent testing reveals a recent mixing of several odors in the air surrounding the item
Scent testing reveals a stale, lingering odor around the item
Temporal memory testing shows the item shows a strong energetic bond with %NAME1%
Temporal memory testing shows the item shows a strong energetic bond with %NAME2%
Analysis reveals fingerprints from both parties. However, %NAME2%'s marks are substantially more faded
%NAME1% is in a dispute with %NAME2% over %TRADEITEM%. %FAULT%. %FAULT_DETAIL%.
They allege the item has been fraudulently sold
They claim to have discovered the item was stolen from a third party
They claim the item is entirely useless in its current form
They allege the item is a worthless fake
They claim the item is a shoddy retrofit
The seller points to their impeccable previous feedback as evidence they are not at fault
However, the seller insists their goods conform to all existing regulations
However, the seller claims %NAME1% was fully aware of the item's history when they bought it
However, the seller insists they disclosed all details during a comprehensive demonstration
However, the seller claims %NAME1% was given ample opportunity to examine the item before purchase
The seller has provided comprehensive documentation of their supply and manufacturing chains
They claim the item fell apart shortly after purchase
They claim the item exploded shortly after purchase
They alledge the item imploded shortly after purchase

They allege the item fell apart in their hands

They claim the item has proved unfit for use

They claim the item is too fragile to use
However, the claimant does have a documented history of %TRADE_HISTORY%
However, the seller denies liability, insisting this is a case of user error
%NAME1% accuses %NAME2% of theft. The missing item is %TRADEITEM%
%NAME1% accuses %NAME2% of poisoning them with tainted %FOOD%
The %TECH_ITEM% on %NAME1%'s starship has failed catastrophically. They accuse %NAME2% of sabotage
%NAME1% claims to have narrowly avoided death at the hands of a professional assassin, hired by %NAME2%
%NAME1% has been the victim of a catastrophic fire. They accuse %NAME2% of arson
%NAME1%'s prizewinning animal companion has recently passed away. They allege %NAME2% slipped poison into their creature pellets
%NAME1% accuses %NAME2% of stealing the results of a long-running plant breeding programme
%NAME1% accuses %NAME2% of illegally sampling their DNA while they slept
%NAME1% accuses %NAME2% of selling illegally modified Exosuit parts
%NAME1% accuses %NAME2% of covertly installing security cameras in their habitation pod
%NAME1% accuses %NAME2% of smuggling %TRADEITEM% past system authorities
%NAME1% accuses %NAME2% of stealing and recklessly driving their Exocraft

%NAME1% accuses %NAME2% of spreading a treacherous heresy

%NAME1% accuses %NAME2% of running %BUSINESS% without a license
%NAME1% accuses %NAME2% of selling worthless silicate tablets under the guise of medical treatment
It is noted that %NAME1% has a history of spying on their neighbours to look for signs of wrongdoing
It is noted that the accused runs a rival business with considerable success
It is noted that there are significant gaps in the settlement recording systems, during which no-one can account for the whereabouts of the accused
They present no evidence, claiming their sources must be protected at all costs
They present photographs as evidence, though the images are suspiciously grainy
It is noted that both parties had previous been partners in an unspecified commercial enterprise
It is noted that the accused has several unexplained absences in their settlement tracking records
It is noted that the accused has recently filed a significant loss with the settlement accounting authorities
It is noted that %NAME1% has recently filed a significant loss with the settlement accounting authorities
It is noted that the accused has a record of unprovoked violent outbursts
It is noted that both parties have a series of recent offworld excursions, often at the same time. Neither will elaborate
It is noted that the parties have a bitter history, exhibiting an escalating pattern of litigation and complaint
It is noted that the parties have a bitter history. %NAME1% has previously been sentenced for a series of property crimes against %NAME2%
It is noted that %NAME2% recently quarrelled with %NAME1%, but was unable to prove their claims

They feel it would be prudent to impose a tax, to both dampen enthusiasm and improve the settlement's finances
They suggest the imposition of a hefty tax, to take advantage of this mania for as long as it persists
They feel creating a new tax will reverse this trend, or if not, then at least the settlement will profit
They trust the Overseer senses the opportunity this presents, and present the figures a tax would generate..
They note it is not their place to dictate what citizens can or cannot do. They also note the effect a tax may have on this trend..
They feel a new tax would reduce their worries, as well as being beneficial for the settlement's finances
They feel the only sensible action would be an immediate ban
Action must be taken. They suggest an immediate ban

They find this abhorrent, and ask that you take immediate steps

They insist upon immediate corrective action

The citizenry request a festival, to celebrate %PARTY%

The citizenry have proposed a festival, in remembrance of %PARTY%

Citizens have petitioned with %PLANS% for the development of a new <TECHNOLOGY>%BUILDING1%<>. Data indicates a <TRADEABLE>%GOODNUM%%<> approval for new construction.

Citizens have submitted %PLANS% for the development of both a new <TECHNOLOGY>%BUILDING1%<> and a <TECHNOLOGY>%BUILDING2%<>. Data indicates a <STELLAR>%MIDNUM1%%<> approval rating for the %BUILDING1%, while <STELLAR>%MIDNUM2%%<> approve of the %BUILDING2%.
<VAL_ON>Resolution required:<> Begin construction of which building?
Adventurous-minded citizens have proposed an expedition
A small group of citizens seek your permission to begin an expedition
A group of adventurous citizens wish to leave the settlement
A number of citizens wish to explore the planet
A group of citizens wish to undertake a expedition across the planet
They wish to discover the fate of a former Overseer who fled the settlement to make a life among the caves
They have identified a nearby freighter wreck, and believe they might recover valuable salvage
They believe they have identified a nest of biological horrors and wish to exterminate them, for the greater good
They wish to test their new underwater breathing equipment, and hope to recover valuable gems whilst beneath the waves
They are haunted by a crimson dream. The scarlet echo is leading them to an abandoned structure beyond our walls, and they are compelled to seek answers
They wish to conduct a test drill in a local cave network. Their maps indicate several valuable mineral lodes, if they can only mine deep enough..
They have picked up a distress signal on the planetary radar. The signal is several days away, but duty compels them to respond
There was a recent conflict between pirates and a freighter fleet in the upper atmosphere. They propose to harvest scrap and salvage from the fallen remains
Their weather algorithm indicates we are approaching the peak of a storm crystal event. They have renovated a Minotaur Heavy Exosuit unit and feel this is the perfect time to test it
They have been tracking a spectacular meteor shower. They wish to locate the impact sites and harvest whatever they can find - valuable minerals, space dust, alien microbes, and so on.
They wish to conduct a thorough survey of the local fauna, so that the settlement might benefit from a DNA catalogue
They wish to conduct a thorough survey of the local flora, so that the settlement might benefit from its own seedbank
They wish to take photographs of the settlements surroundings, so that we might better understand and appreciate the planet that we now call home
They having a training and breeding programme in mind, and wish to search among local fauna for suitable animal companions
A friend of theirs wandered out of the settlement at night, never to return. The have vowed to find them, and to do what they can to either help them or honour their memory
They wish to survey the planet for valuable resources. They hope their charts will form the basis for many future expeditions, each of which will bring glory and riches to the settlement
They have been cooped up inside the settlement walls for too long. They simply wish to experience the thrill of adventure, the excitement of stepping out into the unknown
They have come into possession of an ancient map. The map indicates a relic site a few days march from the settlement, and they feel compelled to investigate
They have heard whisperings of a grand treasure out in the wilderness beyond the settlement walls. They wish to put these rumours to the test
They have suffered enough of the relentless attacks of the Sentinels. They wish to head out into the wilds and locate the source of the drone scourge, so that it may be eliminated once and for all
They want to make maps the surrounding area, so that in time we may safely expand our settlement into other fertile and productive lands

They have been studying the stars, but their charts are inadequate. They cannot map accurate positional measurements from within the settlement, and need to repeat their survey from a number of locations around the planet

They feel the settlement will always be at risk unless we develop new food sources. They wish to survey the area for nutritional possibilities, and assemble a detailed catalogue of all edible flora and fauna
They wish to secure the settlement's future by uncovering additional water sources. They have all the divination tools they require, and only seek your authorisation for supplies and sundry equipment
They have spotted a plume of unnaturally coloured smoke just beyond the horizon. They feel its source must be investigated
They wish to make a show of force by patrolling the local area. They feel this visibility will deter pirates from any opportunistics raids upon the settlement
They have heard rumours of strange, whispering eggs to found in the wilderness beyond the settlement. They feel it is important to acquire and study these eggs

They feel they are on the verge of an important scientific discovery, but their existing DNA samples are inadequate. They wish to collect additional biological material so that they might complete their experiment
They state simply that they require more skulls, and that the wilderness is the best place to look for them
They wish to locate ancient relics, and feel that a nearby monolith is the perfect place to establish their digsite. They promise the settlement will have full ownership of any artifacts they recover
